articles.headline: Rush Limbaugh Dies at 70; Turned Talk Radio Into a Right-Wing Attack Machine
articles.snippet: With a following of 15 million and a divisive style of mockery, grievance and denigrating language, he was a force in reshaping American conservatism.
articles.abstract: With a following of 15 million and a divisive style of mockery, grievance and denigrating language, he was a force in reshaping American conservatism.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.
articles.byline: By Robert D. McFadden and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: Biden on ‘Short Leash’ as Administration Rethinks China Relations
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is under intense pressure to maintain former President Donald J. Trump’s curbs on China, even as it tries to develop a more comprehensive and effective strategy.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is under intense pressure to maintain former President Donald J. Trump’s curbs on China, even as it tries to develop a more comprehensive and effective strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Biden administration officials have tried to project a tough line on China in their first weeks in office, depicting the authoritarian government as an economic and security challenge to the United States that requires a far more strategic and calculated approach than that of the Trump administration.

articles.headline: Can This Man Save The Baltimore Sun?
articles.snippet: Stewart Bainum, a hotel magnate and former politician, has swooped in with a plan to run it and other papers in Maryland as part of a nonprofit.
articles.abstract: Stewart Bainum, a hotel magnate and former politician, has swooped in with a plan to run it and other papers in Maryland as part of a nonprofit.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the announcement on Tuesday that he had agreed to establish a nonprofit to buy The Baltimore Sun and other Maryland newspapers, the hotel magnate Stewart W. Bainum Jr. is set to go the route of Jeff Bezos, who went into the struggling newspaper business in 2013 by buying The Washington Post after making his fortune in another industry.

articles.headline: Biden Signals He’s Flexible on Immigration Overhaul
articles.snippet: After two decades of failure, advocates for the broadest possible overhaul of the nation’s immigration laws are considering a new strategy: pressing for piecemeal legislation.
articles.abstract: After two decades of failure, advocates for the broadest possible overhaul of the nation’s immigration laws are considering a new strategy: pressing for piecemeal legislation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden has said repeatedly that he wants to create a path to citizenship for all of the 11 million undocumented immigrants in the United States.

articles.headline: Desperate for Light and Warmth, Texans See No End for Winter Storm
articles.snippet: Almost seven million people were being told to boil their water as another barrage of sleet and snow approached. FEMA has sent the state bottled water, blankets and generators.
articles.abstract: Almost seven million people were being told to boil their water as another barrage of sleet and snow approached. FEMA has sent the state bottled water, blankets and generators.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Halfway through the week that Texas froze over, everything seemed to be in a state of frigid chaos.
articles.byline: By Maria Jimenez Moya, Campbell Robertson and Allyson Waller

articles.headline: Should the Feds Guarantee You a Job?
articles.snippet: Not long ago, the question was rarely asked. Now, politicians and economists of various stripes are willing to consider it.
articles.abstract: Not long ago, the question was rarely asked. Now, politicians and economists of various stripes are willing to consider it.
articles.lead_paragraph: What should the president do about jobs?
